Allen Iverson said he did not mind sitting out the final minutes of a blowout victory instead of attempting to set a career high. Honestly, and I can't be any truer than this, all I wanted was for the Milwaukee Bucks to be down one point once there were all zeroes on the board, he said. at Mr. Colin Powell 's contention that he was misled by faulty intelligence into making the public case for the invasion of Iraq.`` Colin Powell was not duped or misled by anybody,'' Mr. Donald Rumsfeld writes. Nor did he lie about Saddam Hussein 's suspected WMD stockpiles. The president did not lie. The vice president did not lie.[ CIA Director President Bush ] Tenet did not lie. Condoleezza Rice did not lie. I did not lie.... The far less dramatic truth is that we were wrong. Even so, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld -- who does reveal that former President Bush asked for Iraq invasion plans within days of 9/11-- argues that removing Saddam Hussein was the right thing to do. campaigner and a`` cordially confrontational'' radio talk-show host. Now he stands poised to run for Indiana's highest office, after turning down urgings from conservative activists to run for president in 2012. We seriously considered it, which for a small town boy from Southern Indiana is a very humbling thing..., Mike Pence said last week.`` But at the end of the day, we ultimately believed that where our little family is led is somewhere in the service of the people of Indiana in the days ahead.''

, Mitch Daniels recently was chosen as the second-most-likely to get the GOP nomination, after Mitt Romney . Mike Pence didn't make the top 10. So why are Mike Pence 's backers so enthusiastic about him? Mike Pence displays the kind of optimism, moral values and gutsy leadership we need in a president-- and a presidential nominee, says the draft-Pence website, theconservativechampion.org.`` He bridges the gap between the establishment and the grassroots,'' wrote influential conservative blogger Erick Erickson on RedState.com. failure of Microsoft's hostile takeover bid for Yahoo has caused the Wall Street Journal to publish a report calling for a sell-off of the company's stock. In a hard-hitting opinion piece, Brett Arends writes: Now is an excellent opportunity to sell any Microsoft stock you have left.
